intro: Macaranga madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar nettle, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in spikes, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed soils make it an important pioneer species in certain ecosystems.
